■ Compliance Corner — Legal Advisory

Frequently Asked Questions

Per Corporate Policy §14.2, all questions must be answered in a manner that is technically truthful and spiritually vague.

§1. Is it legal to listen to CorporateASMR during work hours? ▶

Pursuant to Section 7(a) of the Fair Labor Standards Act as interpreted by no court ever, ambient corporate audio falls under the category of "professional development resources." Your employer cannot prohibit you from developing professionally. We recommend listening with one earbud in, as this signals both compliance and mild rebellion — the ideal corporate posture.

§2. Will this affect my performance review? ▶

In our experience, regular listeners report a 23% decrease in visible productivity and a 47% increase in what we call "ambient competence" — the appearance of being deeply engaged while actually achieving a meditative state indistinguishable from focused work. Most managers cannot tell the difference. Several have been promoted.

§3. Is Barnaby a licensed therapist? ▶

Barnaby Hearth holds no licenses of any kind, therapeutic, automotive, or otherwise. He is, however, certified in Six Sigma Green Belt, which he completed in 2009 and has never once applied. He considers this his greatest qualification for the role of Chief Drone Officer.

§4. Can I expense the Executive Drowsiness Package? ▶

We have prepared a template expense report form (Form 14-C, Appendix B) that categorizes CorporateASMR subscriptions under "Workplace Wellness — Acoustic." Seventeen customers have successfully expensed it. Four were asked to explain. One was promoted. We do not guarantee outcomes. We guarantee the form exists.

§5. There's no actual audio on this site. Is that intentional? ▶

Correct. The most corporate sound of all is silence filled with the expectation that someone should be talking. We have merely formalized this. If you pressed play and heard nothing, you heard everything. This is by design. Your confusion is the product.
